Author: ca333#0118
Content: Thanks for your feedback - the audio notification is a very new feature and we will work on it to make it as pleasant/user-friendly as possible. On android we will likely add an option for a mute thats very close to total silence.

Author: Bitfinger#6245
Content: Would it not be possible to just remove the sound for android? Seems silly android users have to 'suffer' for an iOS workaround.

Author: ca333#0118
Content: Thats not possible cuz of strict release requirements. Sound notification needs to be app-related and not a OS conditioned feature to bypass background process limitation.

Author: Goku#9007
Content:
"cuz of strict release requirements."

Author: Mark81#4505
Content: No they are not setting but in source code this playing sound cannot be ruled out by software automaticaly in terms  of  operating system where it is running.

Author: Mark81#4505
Content: So if Apple sees in code that software is checking if you're in ios then play sound and if in Android then dont they won't pass it. It affects in this way to both worlds by their market leader position.

Author: artemciy_dice#0049
Content: AtomicDEX is in beta and we're only just started testing this functionality. The major question now is whether the Apple would approve the background mode. If they will, then we'll be further improving this functionality with things like choosing different sounds, allowing you to use the sounds from your own sound library and such. Anyhow, thanks for testing the app!
